 TIDS ‘n BITS: With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was also the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes. In 1982, the Bolide handbag was created and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication.

description:
Limited edition Hermes Constance 18 spectacular Marble Silk bag. Accentuated with Rose Extreme Swift leather. This rare technique creates exquisite colours in this intricate design. A Japanese silk marbling technique that was recently discovered by the brand. The search took about 10 years to find the Nose family, in Kyoto, who could execute this craft. Originally it began in Japan in the 12th century by marbling paper. This technique, suminagashi (floating ink)  made it's way to Europe and was applied to fabric. In 1963, the father of the Nose family went to Germany to learn the craft to bring it back to Japan. Now they are only the producers of this technique left in the world.  HERMES PARIS MADE IN FRANCE is stamped on front under flap. Comes with Hermes sleeper and signature Hermes box. NEW or NEVER WORN. As a purveyor of exceptional and unique Hermes luxury goods, mightychic raises the bar of online shopping. final sale 
 BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 7.5" TALL 5.5" DEEP 2" STRAP: SINGLE 22"  DOUBLE 12" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
 TIDS ‘n BITS: During the 12th Century Japan created the technique of Marble Paper, which made its way to Europe. Japan lost that art until the Father of the Nose family went to Germany to learn about the process applied to textile. Today this family is the only one in the world who produces the craft of Suminagashi - Floating Silk. After 10 years of searching Hermes discovered Kyoto Marble and have since collaborated with them exclusively for Marble Silk. Often referred to as a "hundred colour print", most of the process is done by the hands of a craftsman and carries that unique touch. This Hermes video shows the exquisite and rare process of this almost lost art. The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer  unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS ‘n BITS: The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette. 
   PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS 'n BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??   Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

Guaranteed authentic Hermes Bolide 1923 30 bag featured in Blue Sapphire  Taurillon Novillo leather. S leek, clean, and modern with palladium hardware. Dome shaped with roomy interior, easy to open zipper, and oval leather patch. Lightweight and extremely comfortable to carry.  A classic for the ages. Made from smooth Bull leather, with a finely textured grain that is much finer than Togo or Clemence, it lends to being scratch resistant.  TIDS ‘n BITS:   With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turn lock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly.
title: Hermes Kelly Cut Clutch Bag Black Swift Palladium Hardware

A cute, casual,  and whimsical bag with a somewhat slouchy shape to it.  TIDS 'N BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??   Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags!  Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman.  The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

 TIDS 'n BITS 
 As you may know, the Bolide was the first bag to incorporate the zipper, and debued at the time of the  automobile to travel in luxury. But before that, when travel was still popular by horse, the Haut a Courroies was the firstborn of Hermes. Created to carry and protect riding boots and saddles for riders, it was likely the original step to offer elegance and luxury in a practical bag for riders. With the rising popularity of the automobile it continued as as a bold and stunning travel bag. "An intriguing detail: this ambassador for the house’s history of saddlery and itinerancy had no name. Tall (haut) and equipped with straps (courroies), it became the Haut à courroies. Strong, calm and straightforward." hermes Today this timeless trapezoid design and classic lines is still considered the pinnacle of travel and / or work bags in the the world.
title: Hermes Birkin 40 HAC Limited Edition Runway Embroidered Bag

Being the original leather for Hermes bags, Box leather has retained its provenance and heritage and is among the most special addition to any collection. The perfect sophistication of palladium hardware accentuates this beautiful Birkin bag.  This beauty will take you year round.  Comes with the lock and keys in the clochette, sleepers, raincoat and signature Hermes box.  NEW or NEVER WORN.  TIDS 'n BITS 
 Considered a Holy Grail among the Hermes leather family, Box leather is extremely rare to find – and even more so in the Birkin bag. 
 Named after Joseph Box, a British shoe craftsman during the 1890s.  Its remarkable smooth texture gains a beautiful patina over time, and its studier composition retains the shape of the Birkin and Kelly bags.  When carrying your bag the leather will reflect either as matte or reveal its gorgeous glossy finish – depending on the light. 
 Hermes considers the true beauty of the leather to unfold with use and the eventual patina.  The markings you will gain with usage will blend, and lighter markings can be buffed to diminish.  Mr. Dumas once said that each bag has a story.  And by that he referred to the markings on leather with use.  Box leather will allow to recall those life moments making this a most special piece in your wardrobe.    This remarkable leather is also easily restored at the Hermes Spa.  However, always carry your raincoat in your bag, as water is not friendly to Box leather. 
 From brand new, to gaining her character, a Box leather bag will always exude iconic sophistication.
title: Hermes Birkin 30 Black Box Leather Bag Palladium Hardware

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bags payments require bank wire transfer  unless arrangements are made prior to purchase.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was also the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes. In 1982, the Bolide handbag was created and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was also the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes. In 1982, the Bolide handbag was created and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:  
 The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.
title: Hermes Constance 18 Desert Lizard Bag Palladium Hardware Limited Edition

 TIDS ‘n BITS: The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette. 
   PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

description:
Guaranteed authentic Hermes Bolide 1923 30 bag featured in Black  Taurillon Novillo leather. S leek, clean, and modern with gold hardware. Dome shaped with roomy interior, easy to open zipper, and oval leather patch. Lightweight and extremely comfortable to carry.  A classic for the ages. Made from smooth Bull leather, with a finely textured grain that is much finer than Togo or Clemence, it lends to being scratch resistant. Rich in saturation, it absorbs colours beautifully like Chevre and Epsom. Comes with lock and keys and clochette, sleepers and signature Hermes box. NEW or NEVER WORN. final sale 
 
 TIDS ‘n BITS:   With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes.

 TIDS 'n BITS Vache Country leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2012.   Processed female calf skin with  fair firmness is known for its large grain and durability is mainly used for the Garden Party.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of colours accommodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

 BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 7.5" TALL 5.5" DEEP 2" STRAP: SINGLE 22"  DOUBLE 12" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN   
 TIDS ‘n BITS: The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

Richly saturated this is a magnificent neutral bag that adds a pop a colour. Signature stamp on interior. Small interior compartment. Comes with sleeper and signature Hermes box with ribbon.  NEW or NEVER WORN  final sale BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 8.75"  TALL 5" DEEP 2.2" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly. The Kelly Pochette is adorable and looks more like a small pouch with a flat wide base that allows it to stand on its own. The Kelly Pochette is more spacious than the Kelly Cut which makes it more functional and it’s one of the most desired clutches in the Hermès bag collection. 
 
 PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS 'n BITS The ladies' bag with straps Robert Dumas created in 1930 was an elegant, functional bga geared toward independent women.  The Kelly is sewn backwards and turned inside out - the most difficult part of the workmanship. There are 36 pieces to be assembled, 16 studs and 680 hand sewn stitches.  The padlock, clochette, and swivel clasp are the final added classic staples. It took until 1956 to claim her name when Grace Kelly hides her baby bump with what was then called the sac a depeche. Over the years she has design elements added, such as Osier, sizes, leather work in the Lettre, but her beautiful lines have never changed! Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag. Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

 TIDS 'n BITS Vache Country leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2012.   Processed female calf skin with  fair firmness is known for its large grain and durability is mainly used for the Garden Party.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of colours accommodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS 'N BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??   Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags!  Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman.  The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create. PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

description:
Guaranteed authentic Hermes Garden Party tote featured in Lime Toile Officier with White Vache Country leather. This crisp and fresh Garden Party 30 bag is the perfect about town tote.  Durable and strong toile reinforced with the leather base and sides that end in the rolled handles.  Accentuated with palladium Clou de Selle.  Comes with signature Hermes box and sleeper.  NEW or NEVER WORN final sale BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 30cm / 11.8" TALL 21cm / 8.3" DEEP 13cm / 5.1" HANDLES: TALL 10cm / 4" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
 
 TIDS 'n BITS Vache Country leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2012.   Processed female calf skin with  fair firmness is known for its large grain and durability is mainly used for the Garden Party.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of colours accomodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

It was also the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes. In 1982, the Bolide handbag was created and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette. 
 PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes.

 TIDS 'n BITS The ladies' bag with straps Robert Dumas created in 1930 was an elegant,  functional bga geared toward independent women.  The Kelly is sewn backwards and turned inside out - the most difficult part of the workmanship. There are 36 pieces to be assembled, 16 studs and 680 hand sewn stitches.  The padlock, clochette, and swivel clasp are the final added classic staples. It took until 1956 to claim her name when Grace Kelly hides her baby bumb  with what until called the sac a depeche. Over the years she has design elements added, such as Osier, sizes, leather work in the Lettre, but her beautiful lines have never changed!  Beautiful muted blue gray and utterly neutral. Fresh with palladium hardware. Carried by hand, over the shoulder, or cross body.  HERMES PARIS MADE IN FRANCE is stamped on front under flap.  Comes with Hermes sleeper and signature box. NEW or NEVER WORN.  final sale

 TIDS ‘n BITS: 
   
 The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly.  TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly. The Kelly Pochette is adorable and looks more like a small pouch with a flat wide base that allows it to stand on its own. The Kelly Pochette is more spacious than the Kelly Cut which makes it more functional and it’s one of the most desired clutches in the Hermès bag collection.

 TIDS 'n BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag. Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

 TIDS 'n BITS: The Kelly Osier was first spotted in 2011 and is a testament to the innovative mindset to create such a classic with unique material interpretation.  Only the best artisans work the delicate Osier in the iconic basket weave which is paired with the coveted Barenia leather. In 2016 the Summer Picnic Party saw the addition of a number of creative pieces, such as the Farming Bag. The very limited Picnic Kelly has remained as one of the most sought after creations for the Hermes collector.   
 The Kelly story found its notoriety with the ever elegant Princess Grace Kelly.  She was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time.    TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly. The Kelly Pochette is adorable and looks more like a small pouch with a flat wide base that allows it to stand on its own. The Kelly Pochette is more spacious than the Kelly Cut which makes it more functional and it’s one of the most desired clutches in the Hermès bag collection.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly. The Kelly Pochette is adorable and looks more like a small pouch with a flat wide base that allows it to stand on its own. The Kelly Pochette is more spacious than the Kelly Cut which makes it more functional and it’s one of the most desired clutches in the Hermès bag collection.

Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag. Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

description:
Guaranteed authentic Hermes Garden Party 36 Pockets bag featured in Black.  This timeless tote bag is accentuated in plush Negonda leather. Fresh palladium Clou de Selle hardware. Herringbone canvas lining and interior zipper pocket. Comes with signature Hermes box and sleeper.  NEW or NEVER WORN final sale BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 36cm / 14.25" TALL 26cm / 10.25" DEEP 17cm / 6.75" HANDLES: TALL 14cm / 5.5" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
   
 
 TIDS 'n BITS Negonda leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2007.   Used only the the Garden Party, the large grain has a matte finish which lends to a rich effect of the unique colours offered.  Negonda leather is water resistant and will last you a lifetime.  It also holds the shape of the bag beautifully.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of hues accommodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

 TIDS 'n BITS The ladies' bag with straps Robert Dumas created in 1930 was an elegant, functional bga geared toward independent women.  The Kelly is sewn backwards and turned inside out - the most difficult part of the workmanship. There are 36 pieces to be assembled, 16 studs and 680 hand sewn stitches.  The padlock, clochette, and swivel clasp are the final added classic staples. It took until 1956 to claim her name when Grace Kelly hides her baby bump with what was then called the sac a depeche. Over the years she has design elements added, such as Osier, sizes, leather work in the Lettre, but her beautiful lines have never changed! We now enter 22 years of expertise and guidance, and the knowledge that we stand behind all we offer.  TIDS 'n BITS The ladies' bag with straps Robert Dumas created in 1930 was an elegant, functional bga geared toward independent women.  The Kelly is sewn backwards and turned inside out - the most difficult part of the workmanship. There are 36 pieces to be assembled, 16 studs and 680 hand sewn stitches.  The padlock, clochette, and swivel clasp are the final added classic staples. It took until 1956 to claim her name when Grace Kelly hides her baby bump with what was then called the sac a depeche. Over the years she has design elements added, such as Osier, sizes, leather work in the Lettre, but her beautiful lines have never changed! We now enter 22 years of expertise and guidance, and the knowledge that we stand behind all we offer. description:
Guaranteed authentic Hermes Garden Party 36 Pockets bag featured in Blue Indigo.  This rich colour is accentuated in plush Negonda leather. Fresh palladium Clou de Selle hardware. Herringbone canvas lining and interior zipper pocket. Comes with signature Hermes box and sleeper.  NEW or NEVER WORN final sale BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 36cm / 14.25" TALL 26cm / 10.25" DEEP 17cm / 6.75" HANDLES: TALL 14cm / 5.5" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
   
 
 TIDS 'n BITS Negonda leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2007.   Used only the the Garden Party, the large grain has a matte finish which lends to a rich effect of the unique colours offered.  Negonda leather is water resistant and will last you a lifetime.  It also holds the shape of the bag beautifully.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of hues accommodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag. Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

 TIDS 'n BITS 
 The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:   
 The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS 'N BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??   Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags!  Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman.  The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create. PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS 'n BITS: The Kelly Osier was first spotted in 2011 and is a testament to the innovative mindset to create such a classic with unique material interpretation.  Only the best artisans work the delicate Osier in the iconic basket weave which is paired with the coveted Barenia leather. In 2016 the Summer Picnic Party saw the addition of a number of creative pieces, such as the Farming Bag. The very limited Picnic Kelly has remained as one of the most sought after creations for the Hermes collector.   
 The Kelly story found its notoriety with the ever elegant Princess Grace Kelly.  She was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??  Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman.  The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: With a long and storied history, the Bolide (French word for meteor) was designed for the wife of Emile-Maurice Hermes in the early 20s and named for the first era of fast cars. It was also the first bag to incorporate the use of a zipper. The elegant Bolide is the prelude to customized luggage and accessories for travel by Hermes. In 1982, the Bolide handbag was created and has become associated with understated elegance and sophistication.

NEW or NEVER WORN final sale BAG MEASURES: LENGTH 30cm / 11.8" TALL 21cm / 8.3" DEEP 13cm / 5.1" HANDLES: TALL 10cm / 4" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
   
 
 TIDS 'n BITS Vache Country leather was introduced to the Hermes family of leathers in 2012.   Processed female calf skin with  fair firmness is known for its large grain and durability is mainly used for the Garden Party.  
 The Garden Party has functional Clou de Selle snaps that allow you to streamline the tote, or unsnap for a more casual look.  Light in weight with Toile or Canvas, this makes for a perfect to go tote bag.  The rolled leather handles make the bag very comfortable to carry. 
 The structured style give the Garden Party tote versatility to use in a variety of ways.  Dress the handles in twillies, add some bag charms and you are ready for lunch with friends.  Running an errand?  Prefer a more clean slate look? Just grab and go! 
 A wide array of hues accommodates your individual style, and/or brings fun pops of colour to your wardrobe.

 TIDS ‘n BITS:  The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.

 TIDS ‘n BITS: 
 The Hermès Trim bag, also known as the “Jackie”, is the famous shoulder bag carried by Jackie Kennedy Onassis. It’s one of Hermès most classic bags with a simple yet elegant design that will never go out of style. The original version of this style, the “Trim I”, was created without a zipper top closure and has a slimmer profile and base than the “Trim II”. The inside of both features an open space with one zip pocket and one open pocket. Now discontinued, this elegant bag is a timeless classic and highly sought after by collectors.

 TIDS ‘n BITS Inspired by the iconic Princess Grace Kelly of Monaco, the Hermès Kelly bag is the definition of timeless elegance. It ranks as one of the most desired handbags in the world making it scarce and a coveted bag to own. Exuding a chic look, they are iconic and a true symbol of luxury. The Kelly Cut and the Kelly Pochette are smaller, clutch style versions of the Kelly bag. Both are quite similar, featuring the same single top handle, flap, sangles, and turnlock closure as the original size Kelly bag. However, there are significant differences between the two styles. The Kelly Cut has a sharp rectangular shape and is longer and thinner than the Kelly Pochette. Although the Kelly Cut is often viewed as more elegant, both styles are classy and versatile, transitioning from day to night effortlessly. PLEASE NOTE: Hermes bag payments require bank wire transfer unless arrangements are made prior to purchase

 TIDS 'n BITS Grace Kelly was a lover of Hermes before she made the 'Kelly bag' a timeless icon with the famous photo of her hiding her pregnancy with the shield of her Sac à dépêches bag.  Wait, Sac à dépêches??   Yes, that was the original name for this classic handbag with a purist aesthetic which was a departure of the decorative handbags of the time. That fabulous photograph is what brought the name Kelly bag which remains to this day. She also had a love of the Kelly bag in Crocodile which became the MUST HAVE status bag and created even more popularity for Hermes Crocodile bags! Each Hermes bag takes extreme skill and is made by one Hermes craftsman. The Kelly bag takes approximately 18 hours to create.

description:
Guaranteed authentic limited edition Hermes Constance 24 spectacular Marble Silk bag. Accentuated with Rose Extreme Swift leather. This rare technique creates exquisite colours in this intricate design. A Japanese silk marbling technique that was recently discovered by the brand. The search took about 10 years to find the Nose family, in Kyoto, who could execute this craft.  Originally it began in Japan in the 12th century by marbling paper. This technique, suminagashi (floating ink)  made it's way to Europe and was applied to fabric. In 1963, the father of the Nose family went to Germany to learn the craft to bring it back to Japan. Now they are only the producers of this technique left in the world.  HERMES PARIS MADE IN FRANCE  is stamped on front under flap.  Comes with Hermes sleeper and signature Hermes  box. NEW or NEVER WORN The  Hermes  Constance bag price maintains its value as its among one of the most desired and difficult  Hermes  bags to acquire. As a purveyor of exceptional and unique Hermes luxury goods, mightychic raises the bar of online shopping. final sale   
 BAG MEASURES: LENGTH  24 cm / 9.5" TALL 15cm / 6" DEEP  5 cm /  2 " 
 STRAP: SINGLE 22"  DOUBLE 12" CONDITION: NEW or NEVER WORN 
 TIDS ‘n BITS:   During the 12th Century Japan created the technique of Marble Paper, which made its way to Europe. Japan lost that art until the Father of the Nose family went to Germany to learn about the process applied to textile. Today this family is the only one in the world who produces  the craft of Suminagashi - Floating Silk. After 10 years of searching Hermes discovered Kyoto Marble and have since collaborated with them exclusively for Marble Silk. Often referred to as a "hundred colour print", most of the process is done by the hands of a craftsman and  carries that unique touch. This Hermes video shows the exquisite and rare process of this almost lost art. 
 
 ABOUT THE BAG 
 The Hermès Constance was originally created in 1959 by in house designer Catherine Chaillet and named after her daughter. This sophisticated shoulder bag with clean lines and a long leather strap that can be doubled, lends itself to a variety of looks. The signature “H” emblem clasp is the bag’s most distinct and attractive feature. In 2010 the bag received a slight modification with Hermès offering it in a longer, narrower design named the Elan. This elegant bag is now available in four sizes, the micro, mini, 24, and Elan. As a testament to the house of Hermès’ impeccable craftsmanship, each bag is crafted by only one artisan and takes 14 hours to create. An iconic bag that was a personal favorite of Jackie O. and now seen carried by many celebrities, the Constance has become one of Hermès most recognizable and loved bags with its timeless silhouette.
